project.teaser: Each year about 110.000t of carbon fibre composite parts and 4.500.000t of glass fibre composites are used. 98% of these parts end up in landfills at the end of their life. To address this problem the MC4 project aims at establishing a multi-level circular process for carbon...
project.objective: Each year about 110.000t of carbon fibre composite parts and 4.500.000t of glass fibre composites are used. 98% of these parts end up in landfills at the end of their life. To address this problem the MC4 project aims at establishing a multi-level circular process for carbon and glass fibre composite. Multi-level means that processes will be developed for short-term implementation with immediate impact and for the longer term with a wider impact on industry. Carbon and glass fibre have substantially different costs and the project takes this into account by developing economically feasible procedures that are based on chemical matrix/fibre separation for carbon fibre and on a new type of resing for the direct re-use of the composite for glass fibre. Quality grading of the recycled material will be a key element to ensure a proper use in the different domains. Within the supply chain investigated in the project the goal is to achieve a recycling rate of at least 60%. As an additional benefit, the project will enable European material manufacturers to develop their own, patented processes for manufacturing of recycled material. Currently, 80% of the manufacturing of virgin carbon and glass fibre is taking place outside of Europe and the manufacturing technologies used inside of Europe are often licensed from foreign countries. MC4 puts particular emphasis on the design and manufacturing of best practice examples of parts made from recycled materials. For five different domains, including automotive, aerospace, sports equipment, boats and urban furniture, composite products will be manufactured, with the aim of demonstrating the use of recycled material and enhancing the demand side for recycled material in the different domains. The consortium includes process developers, material manufacturers and SME end users, who manufacture composite parts. It covers the whole value chain and thus enables the creation of real circular process for composites.
project.title: Multi-level Circular Process Chain for Carbon and Glass Fibre Composites

result.title: PATHWAYS FOR RECYCLING OF CARBON AND GLASS FIBRE COMPOSITES

details.authors: Christian Eitzinger (Profactor)
details.journalTitle: ICCM International Conference on Composite Materials

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: The deliverable will include a plan describing the data collected throughout the project, their status and how non-confidential research data will be made available to other researchers in a repository.

result.title: MC4 - Multi-level Kreislaufsysteme für carbonfaserverstärkte und glasfeserverstärkte Kunststoffe

details.authors: Johannes Leis, Romy Naumann, Anna Große (STFI)

result.title: Design of civil engineering part: joining collets for pipe lines
result.description: The deliverable will include the design of a part for the particular domain, taking the mechanical and visual properties of recycle material into account. The load case scenario will be described as well.

result.title: Circular process chains for carbon fiber coposites - topics, trends and perspectives

details.authors: Johannes Leis (STFI), Romy Naumann(STFI), Marcel Hofmann(STFI), Anna Große(STFI), Thomas Roure (Chomarat), Christian Eitzinger(Profactor)

result.title: Closing the loop

details.authors: Romy Naumann (STFI)

result.title: Life cycle analysis of circular production process
result.description: The report will include an analysis of the environmental and economic impact of the new, circular manufacturing process and its variants as developed in the project. A comparison will be made to the conventional, linear process.

result.title: Sorting method for glass fibre parts
result.description: A prototype implementation of spectroscopic sorting method with inline capabilities for the sorting of end-of-life glass fibre parts according to the type of resin will be set up. Tests results will be provided and a design for upscaling to large quantities.

result.title: Sensor for Quality Control of Semi-finished Materials from Recycled Carbon Fibre

details.authors: Alexander Walch (Profactor)

result.title: Dataset in Repository
result.description: This deliverable will be a data set that is made publicly available in the Zenodo repository. It will include suitably structured data and meta-information to make the data usable for other researchers.

result.title: Final demonstration and evaluation report
result.description: This demonstration will show all processing and recycling steps that have been developed, including the quality grading systems. An evaluation report with sample parts and an assessment relative to the expected outcomes will be provided.

result.title: Quality control and grading systems
result.description: The prototype deliverable will consist of the quality control and quality grading systems implemented for the spinning, weaving and nonwoven processes. Test result of materials of different quality will be reported and an outlook about the full integration with the manufacturing process will be provided.

result.title: Recycling fibre-reinforced composite parts

details.authors: Asier Asueta (Fundación GAIKER)

result.title: Sample materials for parts manufacturing
result.description: This deliverable will consists of a set of sample materials manufactured for part production in WP6. It will report about the quantities of carbon fibre fabric and will provide a characterization of the resulting material properties to be correlated with mechanical part performance.

result.title: Project web page and visual identity
result.description: This deliverable is the project web page and a “visual identity” package. The report will describe the structure, the content and the intended use of the web page, as well as the logo, colours, fonts, styles and templates to be used by all project partners in the project.

result.title: Liquid recycled fraction for amine epoxy resin
result.description: Demonstration of analysis and phase separation of retrieved liquid fraction suitable for application in NOMA’s virgin epoxy resin with different mixture ratios.

details.authors: VDL Fibertech

result.title: Assessment of parts made from recycled material
result.description: "This deliverable will consist of sample parts manufactured from recycled material for all domains investigated in the project. Results of the characterization of the parts will be provided and compared to requirements as well as to ""conventional"" (i.e. using virgin material) designs. In addition, for each part marketing-oriented visual material (one page per part) will be included as well."

result.title: Sorting method for carbon fibre parts
result.description: This report will describe the experimental setup and the results of inline spectroscopy for the sorting of end-of-life carbon fibre parts.

result.title: Final report on standardization
result.description: The report will address relevant standards that relate to the use of recycled material in the different domains also including the results of interactions with OEMs in the different domains.

category.title: recycling
category.displayCode: /engineering and technology/environmental engineering/waste management/waste treatment processes/recycling

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
